project_abstract.cdata: The Second National Low Income Housing Project seeks to finance a share of BEV's 1988-1993 investment program which is to be implemented throughout Ecuador through BEV, JNV and private developers.  It aims to support adoption of new financial policies and instruments to improve resource mobilization and allocation and housing affordability in the sector and promote institutional reforms within BEV and JNV to make them more efficient.  The loan intends to finance (i) approximately 12,000 serviced lots with or without dwelling units, (ii) about 15,000 home improvement credits (iii) vehicles and equipment for project implementation and (iv) technical assistance for project agencies.
